ygData.msgSnippet: Hi everyone, I think I ve found the reason why this error occurs: The temperature is out of range in the NASA thermodynamic coefficient. So, I ve done several

Hi everyone,

I think I've found the reason why this error occurs:
The temp=
erature is out of range in the NASA thermodynamic coefficient.

So, I've do=
ne several successful calculations replacing the upper 
limit (generally 35=
00 K or 3000K) by 5500K.
That`s why, but I don't know if it's already the c=
ase, I think, that 
the best solution to compute the thermodynamic coeffici=
ent, is to 
consider them as constant over the upper temperature fixed in t=
he CTI 
file.

For example :
if 3500 K is the upper limit in the NASA polyn=
omial parameterization, 
when T>3500 Cp(T)=3DCp(3500).

Where can I make th=
ese modifications in the source code ?






--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com=
, "Guillaume" <guillaume.daill@...> 
wrote:
>
> I have find the answer in y=
his message :
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/cantera/message/105
> 
> i qu=
ote :
> Also, compositions that correspond to exactly stoichiometric 
> com=
bustion
> often cause 'equilibrate' to fail to converge, since the equilibr=
ium
> composition is a very sensitive function of equivalence ratio here. 
=
> The
> solution is to move away a very small amount from this composition.=

> 
> 
> =3D> My mixture corresponds to the stoichiometric... 
> 
> 
> 
> -=
